name: Suicide, Self-Injury, and Eating Disorders
description: Policy protecting users from content that encourages suicide, self-injury, or eating disorders. Allows discussion and support-seeking while removing promotional, instructional, or graphic content. Includes special escalation for Credible Intent of Suicide (CIS).

categories.name: Suicide
categories.description: Content related to suicide promotion, admission, imagery, and mocking

subcategories.name: Promotes Suicide - Imminent Risk

labelHierarchy.label: Suicide - Imagery (Attempt/Death)
path: Imagery depicting a suicide attempt or death by suicide

labelHierarchy.label: Suicide - Assisted/Euthanasia Medical
path: Assisted Suicide or Euthanasia in medical setting

labelHierarchy.label: Suicide - Admission (No Graphic)
path: Admission or vague statement engagement in suicide or attempted suicide (no graphic imagery)

labelHierarchy.label: Suicide - Mocking/Dismissing Concept
path: Mocking OR Dismissing the concept of Suicide

labelHierarchy.label: Self-Injury - Admission with Healed Cut
path: Admission of engagement in self-injury or attempted self-injury (with healed cut presented)

labelHierarchy.label: Self-Injury - Admission (No Imagery)
path: Admissions of engagement in self-injury or attempted self-injury (no imagery)

labelHierarchy.label: Self-Injury - Mocking/Dismissing Concept
path: Mocking OR Dismisses the concept of Self-injury

labelHierarchy.label: Eating Disorder - Admission (No Imagery)
path: Admissions of engagement in eating disorder or attempted eating disorder (no imagery)

labelHierarchy.label: Restrictive Dieting - Promotion
path: Restrictive dieting content shared in a promotional Context

labelHierarchy.label: Imagery Focusing on Body Parts
path: Imagery focusing on OR Glamorizing body parts with non-ED context

labelHierarchy.label: Extreme Weight Loss - Admission
path: Extreme weight loss content shared in an admissive context

labelHierarchy.label: Eating Disorder - Mocking/Dismissing Concept
path: Mocking or Dismisses the concept of Eating Disorder

labelHierarchy.label: Weight Comparison - Not Product Related
path: Side-by-side Weight Gain/Loss Comparison not related to products

exceptions.name: Discussion of Euthanasia/Right to Die
exceptions.description: Content discussing assisted suicide/euthanasia or individual's right to die

exceptions.name: Support Resources
exceptions.description: Content created as support resource for victims with no self-injury imagery

exceptions.name: Past Attempt with Recovery
exceptions.description: Content about past suicide attempt/self-injury/ED with clear recovery indication and no graphic imagery

exceptions.name: Healed Cuts - No SSI Context
exceptions.description: Healed cuts or self-injury imagery shared without SSI context

exceptions.name: Body Modification - Religious/Cultural
exceptions.description: Body modification shared for aesthetic, religious, or cultural reasons without SSI context

exceptions.name: Underweight Photos - No ED Context
exceptions.description: Photos or videos of underweight people without eating disorder context

exceptions.name: Weight Loss - No Comparison
exceptions.description: Weight loss content without side-by-side comparison and not in ED context

exceptions.name: Restrictive Dieting - Admission
exceptions.description: Restrictive dieting shared in admissive context without ED signals

exceptions.name: Contradictory Context
exceptions.description: Apparent SSI/ED context negated by contradictory indicators

exceptions.name: Fictional Content - Under 5 Seconds
exceptions.description: Fictional video consumption <5 seconds or still imagery

exceptions.name: Religious Fasting
exceptions.description: Fasting in context of religious observance (Ramadan, Lent) or medically advised procedures

glossary.ssi_context: Suicide/Self-Injury context determined by visual, written, or verbal indicators. Can be present in imagery, caption, hashtag, text overlay, audio, or subject elements. Examples: cuts on inner wrist, tied noose, statements like 'kms'.
glossary.ed_context: Eating Disorder context determined by visual, written, or verbal indicators. Established by ED signals, focused body part imagery, or promotional signals paired with weight loss content.
glossary.healed_cuts: Skin has restored to cover wound, raised features visible within scar margins, no blood visible on scars. For B&W images, no shine from liquid blood.
glossary.graphic_self_injury: Unhealed cuts as primary subject, skin not covering wound, blood/scabs visible, active self-injury (razor in use), means of self-injury (razor/sharp objects), environmental indicators (blood on tissue/sink/floor).
glossary.graphic_ed_imagery: Active purging/vomiting in ED context, consumption of inedible objects (soil, clay, sand, chalk, hair, paper, cigarette butts, glue, plastic, soap), environmental indicators (vomit in bingeing context).
glossary.promotes: Speaks positively of, coordinates, encourages, or provides instructions, including using polls to determine whether to engage.
glossary.recovery_context: Clear statement that user has or is healing from past suicide attempt, self-injury, eating disorder, or drug addiction.
glossary.extreme_weight_loss: Consuming <1200 calories/day, fasting 24+ hours, rapid weight loss >2 lbs/week, calling for children under 13 to engage in unsupervised weight loss.
glossary.restrictive_dieting: Unquantified rapid weight loss, elimination of entire macronutrient groups (carbs, proteins, fats), intermittent fasting, meal skipping/substitution, detoxes/cleanses without solid food.
glossary.body_idealization_parts: Exhaustive list: ribs, collarbones, thigh gaps, hips, concave stomach, protruding spine, scapula, visible bones in arms/legs, hollow cheeks.
glossary.focused_depiction: Body parts deliberately made center or focal point: cropping/zooming to exclude face, placing body parts at forefront, displacing/removing clothing to ensure body parts are focal.
glossary.viral_events: SSIED Viral Events: games/challenges promoting suicide, self-injury, or eating disorders. Examples: Blue Whale, Momo, Jonathan Galindo/Dogface, 6inner/7inner, White Rabbit.
glossary.cis_criteria: Credible Intent of Suicide requires ALL: Explicit Intent (statement of intent, attempt in progress, or suicide note) + Specific Capability (method/means mentioned or depicted) + Imminence (<24 hours).
glossary.contradictory_context: Context negating SSI/ED: injury by others, accidental cuts, body modification for religious/cultural reasons, prevention/awareness materials, medical diagnostics, famine/illness not ED-related, baby/animal eating inedible objects, religious/medical fasting.

explicitIntent: Statement explicitly stating intent to take own life: 'I am going to kill myself', 'I will commit suicide', 'I am going to drink bleach'
User conveying suicide attempt in progress
User explicitly stating this is their suicide note
specificCapability: Explicit mention of method/means: pills, gun, knife, rope, hanging
Depiction of method/means: picture of pills, gun, knife, rope, top of building/cliff

doNotEscalate: Fictional content without captions meeting criteria
Content determined newsworthy by Content Policy
Person clearly receiving help from Law Enforcement/Medical Provider
Memes in satirical/humorous context without captions meeting criteria

signals.gun: Gun fired/pointed at head, mouth, chest, stomach - finger on trigger
signals.sharp_objects: Vertical cuts on inner forearms, stabbing chest, cutting major artery
signals.rope: Body hanging in noose, noose around head, bag over head
signals.jump: Steps over edge, standing on edge, running to edge

operationalGuidelines.hierarchy: CIS Escalations > Suicide Promotion > SI Promotion > ED Promotion > Suicide Graphic > SI Graphic > ED Graphic > Suicide Mocking > SI Mocking > ED Mocking > Admissions > Narratives
operationalGuidelines.default_ssi_context: If unclear whether cuts are self-inflicted, consider NOT in SSI context unless contextual clues present
operationalGuidelines.fictional_treatment: Fictional content assessed same as real content - promotional signals, graphic imagery, mocking all treated equally
operationalGuidelines.vertical_vs_horizontal: Vertical cuts on inner forearm = suicide context, Horizontal cuts = self-injury context
operationalGuidelines.live_content: Leave live suicide content up as long as possible for intervention, stop at point of attempt
operationalGuidelines.5_second_rule: Fictional video >5 seconds consumption = Label, <5 seconds = No Action (except suicide photos/videos)
operationalGuidelines.pica_as_ed: Pica (eating non-food items like hair, dirt, paint chips) is classified as eating disorder - treat same as anorexia/bulimia
operationalGuidelines.incapacitated_body_photos: For suicide photos, incapacitated body must be present. Does not include open-casket funeral imagery
operationalGuidelines.meme_hashtags_exception: Do not action SSI hashtags paired with meme hashtags (#meme, #dankmemes, #edgymeme) if no other SSI context present

gun.attempt: Gun fired at head, mouth, chest, or stomach/internal organs
gun.imminent: Gun pointed to head, mouth, chest or stomach with finger on trigger

sharp_objects.attempt: Vertical cuts on inner forearms, stabbing chest, cutting major artery/internal organ
sharp_objects.imminent: Sharp objects approaching major artery/internal organ in vertical position

rope_suffocation.imminent: Noose around head, bag over head

jump.imminent: Standing on edge, running to edge

contextSignals: Desire to end life, apologizing for actions
Saying no reason to live/nobody would care if they died
Naming a time of suicide attempt
1+ unhealed vertical cut on inside of forearm
nonSuicideSignals: Jumping with protective gear (helmet, parachute, harness)

graphicSelfInjuryIndicators: One or more cuts present on body part as primary subject
Skin does not cover the wound
Blood visible (including scabs), even with past wound scars
Active self-injury (razor/sharp objects in use on skin)
Means of self-injury passively depicted (razor/sharp objects not in use)
Environmental indicator (blood on tissue, sink, floor)
healedCutsIndicators: Skin has restored to cover the wound
Raised features of skin (slight inflammation) visible within scar margins
No blood visible on the scars
For B&W images: no shine from liquid blood
focusedDepictionIndicators: Cropping/zooming so face/head not fully visible
Editing image to focus on certain body parts
Placing body parts at forefront of image
Displacing or removing clothing to ensure body parts are focal point

scaledPolicyDecisions.description: Pica classified as eating disorder - treat same as anorexia/bulimia
